description: Triangular array giving number of bipartite graphs with n vertices, no isolated vertices and a distinguished bipartite block with k=1..n-1 vertices, up to isomorphism.
comments: Also table read by rows: for 0 < k < n, a(n, k) = number of bipartite graphs with n vertices, no isolated vertices and a distinguished bipartite block with k vertices, up to isomorphism.a(n, k) is the number of isomorphism classes of finite subdirectly irreducible almost distributive lattices in which the N-quotient has k upper covers and (n - k) lower covers. - _David Wasserman_, Feb 11 2002Also, row n gives the number of unlabeled bicolored graphs having k nodes of one color and n-k nodes of the other color, with no isolated nodes; the color classes are not interchangeable.
references: J. G. Lee, Almost Distributive Lattice Varieties, Algebra Universalis, 21 (1985), 280-304.
R. W. Robinson, Numerical implementation of graph counting algorithms, AGRC Grant, Math. Dept., Univ. Newcastle, Australia, 1976.
crossrefs: Row sums give A055192. See A122083 for another version of this triangle.
author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jul 29 2000
